revised_title: Chaotic Stochasticity in Epidemics: A New Perspective on Unpredictability
tldr: The authors explore the concept of chaotic stochasticity, a source of unpredictability in epidemics, and argue that it is a common phenomenon in biological dynamics. They discuss the interaction between intrinsic and extrinsic sources of unpredictability and how they can lead to large-scale chaotic behavior in epidemics, even when the mean field equations have periodic and predictable attractors.
